================================== Ai Message ==================================

**Defensive Equipment**

* 2.2: Types of defensive equipment
	+ Shields (2.2.2)
	+ Armor (2.2.4)
* Requirements for defensive equipment:
	+ Must meet requirements in sections 4.11 and 4.12
* Shield specifications:
	+ Rigid object with padded front and sides
	+ Equipped with handles

================================== Ai Message ==================================

**Equipment Classification**

* Offensive and defensive equipment (e.g., weapons, armor)
* Miscellaneous equipment:
	+ Clothing and headwear (non-armor)
	+ Accessories: belts, pouches, boots, quivers, straps, scabbards
* Rules for miscellaneous equipment:
	+ No special rules advantage
	+ May be checked for combat safety and appearance at marshal's discretion

================================== Ai Message ==================================

**Section 3.1**

* 3.1.3: Body-to-weapon contact rules
* 3.1.4: Weapon-to-shield contact rules
* 3.1.5: Shield-to-weapon contact rules
* 3.1.6: Shield-to-shield contact rules
* 3.1.7: Shield-to-body contact rules

================================== Ai Message ==================================

**Index of Document Section 3**

* **3.1**: General rules for combatant contact
	+ 3.1.9: Body to body contact allowed
* **3.2**: Disallowed contact
	+ 3.2.1: Head contact from Class 1, 2, 3 weapons or shields (discouraged)
	+ 3.

================================== Ai Message ==================================

**Index of Key Concepts**

* Target Area Definition
* Strike Types:
	+ Solid: sufficient force required
	+ Insufficient Force: "light", "graze", or "garb"
* Weapon Classification:
	+ Class 1 (one-handed, swung)
	+ Class 2 (two-handed, swung)
* Damage Calculation:
	+ Based on weapon classification and target armor

================================== Ai Message ==================================

**Summary of Section 3.5**

* Two-handed swung weapons: 2 hits, defined as both hands on the weapon at contact (3.5.2.1)
	+ Call "Two" or designated tape color when striking (3.5.2.2)
* Class 3 (thrusting) weapons:
	+ One-handed: 1 hit to unarm

================================== Ai Message ==================================

**Section 3.5: Weapon Rules**

* **Head Armor**: Class 4 weapons striking armored head areas cause no hit.
* **Class 5 Weapons**: 
	+ Unarmored head area: 1 hit
	+ Armored head area: no hit
* **Legal Target Areas for Certain Weapons**:
	+ Arrows/Bolts, Thrown Javelins
